intro: Stegolepis hitchcockii subsp. morichensis, commonly known as the Morichensis steppe buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb with hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems and a subject of interest in plant taxonomy.
